message_1: Find a predicate logic formula for the statement: "There exists a natural number which is not divisible by any smaller natural number."
message_2:
Let P(x, y) be a predicate that represents "x is divisible by y". We can define the predicate logic formula for the given statement as follows:

∃x ∈ ℕ (x > 1 ∧ ¬∃y ∈ ℕ (1 < y < x ∧ P(x, y)))

This formula states that there exists a natural number x greater than 1 such that there is no smaller natural number y (between 1 and x) that divides x.
